main event: A ground-radar and air-visual observation of a Bally-length object in Hanover, Kansas on September 20, 1956.
interesting points: The object traversed for 5 minutes before disappearing and reappearing in approximately 1-minute intervals for 25 minutes,The object would descend and then climb during the observation period,The radar operators were able to track the object,The length of the observation lasted for 2 hours and 50 minutes,Several possible conclusions were drawn including being a balloon or aircraft.
